name: Obesity By State
title: Obesity By State

api_list.name: /name
api_list.description: The 'name' endpoint of the 'ObesityByState' API provides a list of all possible values for the field 'name'. In simpler terms, it gives you the names of different states. For instance, you can find names like California, New York, Florida, and many more. This endpoint allows you to explore and access data specific to each state of the United States. By using this endpoint, you can retrieve information relevant to a particular state, such as obesity rates, health statistics, or any other data related to obesity prevalence. Whether you are conducting research, analyzing trends, or just curious to learn about obesity in different states, this endpoint serves as a gateway to access specific state-level information.

api_list.name: /shapeLength
api_list.description: The 'shapeLength' endpoint in the 'ObesityByState' API provides an array of strings representing different values for the field 'shapeLength'. 'shapeLength' essentially measures the length or size of a particular shape. It helps in identifying the scale or magnitude of a geographical feature, such as the perimeter of a state or district boundary, or the length of a road or coastline.By using this endpoint, users can access a range of values for 'shapeLength', which might correspond to various geographical elements in the dataset. Each string in the array will denote a specific length measurement, representing the size of a particular shape or feature. These values can be utilized for analysis, comparisons, or visualizations, allowing users to gain insights into the spatial characteristics of different regions or objects within the dataset.Though the examples mentioned previously should not be directly mentioned, they signify the kind of values one might encounter with this endpoint: lengthy measurements representing large or complex shapes, which could indicate extensive boundaries or extensive road networks.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the core functionality of the 'ObesityByState' API. It provides users with a powerful tool to retrieve specific information based on their query parameters. By interacting with this endpoint, users can obtain an array of objects containing rows relevant to their queries.With the 'records' endpoint, users can effortlessly explore data related to obesity statistics across different states. The endpoint enables users to customize their search by incorporating query parameters. These parameters allow users to specify criteria such as state, time period, demographic details, or any other relevant factors.By utilizing this endpoint, users gain access to a comprehensive set of information that caters to their specific needs. The array of objects returned by the 'records' endpoint provides valuable insights and analysis about obesity rates, trends, and distribution among various states.Whether users are researchers, health professionals, policymakers, or individuals interested in gaining knowledge about obesity, the 'records' endpoint serves as an invaluable resource for obtaining relevant and up-to-date information.

api_list.name: /fid
api_list.description: The 'fid' endpoint in the 'ObesityByState' API provides a collection of unique identification numbers called 'fid'. These identification numbers represent different categories or attributes related to obesity data. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of strings that encompass all the potential values for the 'fid' field.Each 'fid' value holds significance and corresponds to a specific aspect of obesity data. These identifiers help in organizing and categorizing data, making it easier to retrieve information based on specific criteria or filters. For instance, you might use an 'fid' value to identify obesity rates in different age groups, regions, or demographic segments.By utilizing the 'fid' endpoint, you can explore the various 'fid' values available and use them to retrieve more detailed information about obesity in different contexts. These identifiers enable a more precise analysis of obesity data, aiding researchers, healthcare professionals, and policymakers in better understanding trends, patterns, and variations in obesity rates across different states or populations.

api_list.name: /obesity
api_list.description: The 'obesity' endpoint from the 'ObesityByState' API provides information about the prevalence of obesity in different states. This endpoint returns an array of strings that represent the possible values for the field 'obesity'. Obesity is a medical condition characterized by excess body fat accumulation, which can have significant health implications. The values returned by this endpoint represent obesity rates in percentage for different states. These values can range from low to high, indicating the proportion of individuals within a state who are obese.By accessing this endpoint, users can gain insights into the varying degrees of obesity prevalence across different states. This information can be used for research purposes, public health initiatives, or to compare and analyze obesity rates in different regions. Understanding the distribution of obesity helps in identifying areas that require targeted interventions and allows policymakers to make informed decisions to address this public health concern.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint of the 'ObesityByState' API provides a list of strings that represents different indices related to obesity statistics. These indices serve as identifiers or labels for specific data categories within the dataset. By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve an array of these indices in order to navigate and retrieve relevant information about obesity levels across different states.Each value in the array represents a unique dataListIndex that corresponds to a particular aspect of obesity data. These indices can be used as reference points to access specific subsets or types of obesity-related information. For instance, an index might be associated with the overall obesity rate of a particular state, the obesity prevalence among men or women, specific age groups, or even data related to socioeconomic factors influencing obesity levels.By utilizing the 'dataListIndex' endpoint, users can explore a wide range of available indices, enabling them to analyze and compare obesity data according to various criteria.

api_list.name: /shapeArea
api_list.description: The 'shapeArea' endpoint in the 'ObesityByState' API provides an array of strings that represent the possible values for the field 'shapeArea'. The 'shapeArea' field refers to the area of different shapes used for visualization purposes, such as state boundaries or regions. For instance, a state's shapeArea value could help determine the relative size or proportion of that state compared to others. This information can be used to create visually appealing and informative maps, graphs, or charts related to obesity rates across different regions.By using the 'shapeArea' endpoint, developers or data analysts can access a comprehensive list of all the possible shapeArea values available in the API. This empowers them to explore and manipulate data, gain insights on the geographical distribution of obesity, or design interactive applications that utilize this information in a creative way.
